intro: Dichrotrichum brevipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed dichrotrichum, is a small, annual plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and other open areas. Its life cycle is adapted to short growing seasons, and it is known for its rapid growth and early flowering. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to environmental stress.
